diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Iodide transport defect (ITD) due to a novel mutation in the Na/I symporter (NIS)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of iodide transport defect was supported by the presence of a novel homozygous C to T transition mutation in the 5' untranslated region of the NIS gene, which was associated with a significant decrease in iodide uptake in functional studies. Serum TSH levels were elevated, and thyroid scintigraphy showed reduced radioiodine uptake, consistent with ITD.
